case_vignette:
A 31-year-old man comes to the physician because of pain, tingling, and numbness in his right hand that started 3 months ago. It is worse at night and frequently wakes him up. The symptoms can be relieved by shaking his hands but soon recur. He reports weakness of his right hand, especially when grasping objects. He has type 2 diabetes mellitus. His current medications are metformin and sitagliptin. Four months ago he went on a camping trip. He has been working as a hardscaper for 8 years. His temperature is 37.5°C (99.5°F), pulse is 86/min, and blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg. Examination shows reproduction of his symptoms when his right hand is held above his head for 2 minutes. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 13.2 g/dL
Leukocyte count 7,600/mm3
Hemoglobin A1C 6.3%
Erythrocyte sedimentation rate 13 mm/h
question: Which  is most likely to confirm the diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Neurology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing pain, tingling, and numbness in my right hand that gets worse at night and often wakes me up.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
These symptoms started about 3 months ago.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications regularly?
Yes, I have type 2 diabetes and I take metformin and sitagliptin for it.
What is your age and sex?
I am a 31-year-old man.
Do you have a family history of diabetes or any neurological conditions?
I don't have that information; I'm here to tell you about the pain and numbness in my hand.
Understood. Thank you for the information. Based on your symptoms and medical history, it seems likely that you are experiencing symptoms of carpal tunnel syndrome.

I've been experiencing pain, tingling, and numbness in my right hand for the past 3 months.
May I ask your age and gender?
I am a 31-year-old man.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your right hand?
No, I haven't had any recent injuries or trauma to my right hand.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications regularly?
Yes, I have type 2 diabetes and I take metformin and sitagliptin.
Is there a history of neurological conditions or diabetes in your family?
I don't know, you didn't ask me that before, and I've never mentioned it.
Apologies for that. Is there a history of neurological conditions or diabetes in your family?

Understood, thank you for letting me know. Have you experienced similar symptoms in any other part of your body?
No, I've only had these symptoms in my right hand.

Thank you for the information. Based on your symptoms, medical history, and lack of recent trauma, it is likely that you are experiencing diabetic neuropathy in your right hand. 

**Final Diagnosis:** Diabetic neuropathy
